goal: Move dungeon generation from rpg-api prototype into toolkit dungeon module. API configures, toolkit generates.

sessions.task: Create design document for dungeon generation
sessions.notes: Design covers public API, theme structure, internal components, testing strategy

sessions.task: Create errors.go with validation error definitions
sessions.notes: Added ErrNilInput, ErrInvalidTheme, ErrInvalidCR, ErrInvalidRoomCount using rpgerr package

sessions.task: Create theme.go with Theme struct, WallMaterial, MonsterRef, and predefined themes
sessions.notes: Created WallMaterial typed constant, MonsterRef struct, Theme struct with selectables-based monster/boss pools, RoomTables from environments package, and three predefined themes (ThemeCrypt, ThemeCave, ThemeBanditLair). Added GetTheme() and GetThemeIDs() for lookup.

sessions.task: Create encounter.go with internal budget allocation and encounter generation logic
sessions.notes: Created internal functions: allocateBudget (40% boss / 60% other rooms with difficulty ramping), generateEncounter (fills budget from selection pools), seededRoller (math/rand for reproducibility). All functions use nolint:unused since they're called by generator.go in session 005.

sessions.task: Create generator.go with Generator, GenerateInput/Output, and Generate method
sessions.notes: Created Generator with dependency injection via GeneratorConfig. Generate method implements full pipeline: validate input, generate seed, create spatial layout via GraphBasedGenerator, identify boss room, allocate budget, generate encounters, build DungeonData, load via LoadFromData. Returns *Dungeon runtime wrapper.

sessions.task: Create unit tests for theme and encounter logic
sessions.notes: Created ThemeTestSuite (WallMaterial, MonsterRef, Theme fields, predefined themes, pool selection, GetTheme, GetThemeIDs, obstacle/terrain types) and EncounterTestSuite (allocateBudget single/multi-room, 40%/60% split, difficulty ramp, min CR, generateEncounter nil/zero/budget/boss, seeded roller, helpers). Note: Seed reproducibility test verifies constraints rather than exact output due to Go's non-deterministic map iteration.
generator_test.go - full pipeline tests with real components

sessions.task: Create example/ directory with README and narrated example tests

next_steps: Create example/ directory with README and narrated tests (session 008)

gaps_and_observations.description: buildMonsterTable and buildBossTable are nearly identical - could be consolidated to one function
gaps_and_observations.decision: Leave as-is, internal and simple enough

gaps_and_observations.description: Custom itoa function (lines 286-299) - could use strconv.Itoa()
Monster IDs are 'monster_0', 'monster_1' - may conflict across rooms
gaps_and_observations.decision: Generator should prepend room ID if needed, or address in integration

gaps_and_observations.description: sortRoomIDs uses bubble sort - could use sort.Strings()
gaps_and_observations.decision: Works for small room counts, low priority

gaps_and_observations.description: GetRoomPositions is a public debugging helper - could be internal or removed
Encounters have monster IDs/CRs but no positions yet
gaps_and_observations.decision: Design said 'position placement can come later' - tracked for future

gaps_and_observations.description: Seed reproducibility is limited by selectables package's map iteration - same seed may not produce identical encounters due to Go's non-deterministic map iteration
gaps_and_observations.decision: Tests verify budget constraints rather than exact output. Full reproducibility would require ordered iteration in selectables or sorting by item weight.
